intro: Astragalus ocakverdii, commonly known as the Turkish milkvetch, is a flowering plant species native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is well-developed, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus ocakverdii is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal properties.
